articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Israeli strikes killed 22 people and injured more than 100 in central Beirut on Thursday, Lebanese authorities said, as a senior Hezbollah official evaded an Israeli assassination attempt in the city, according to three security sources.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 22 in Beirut as Hezoballah leader evades assassination

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Hezbollah is preparing for a long war of attrition in south Lebanon, after Israel wiped out its top leadership, with a new military command directing rocket fire and the ground conflict, two sources familiar with its operations said.
articles.title: Hezbollah forges new command for crucial ground war after heavy Israeli blows

articles.author: Gwladys Fouche, Nora Buli
articles.description: Japanese organisation Nihon Hidankyo, a grassroots movement of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki, won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday, in a warning to countries who have nuclear weapons not to use them.
articles.title: Nobel Peace Prize 2024 goes to Japanese nuclear bombs survivors' movement Nihon Hidankyo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Friday there was deep concern in Asia about the plight of people in Gaza and conflict in the Middle East and stressed Washington was doing everything in its power to prevent those from spreading.
articles.title: Blinken says concern in Asia about prospect of Middle East conflicts spreading

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: A Russian missile slammed into a commercial building in Ukraine's southern Odesa region overnight, killing four people including a 16-year-old girl, regional governor Oleh Kiper said on Friday.
articles.title: Russian strikes on Ukraine's Odesa region kill four, governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said on Friday that Israel should "stop killing innocent people", and that its actions in the Middle East were backed by the United States and the European Union.
articles.title: Iranian president says Israel, backed by West, is 'killing innocent people'

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: Korean literature is far less known abroad than Japanese or Chinese works.
articles.title: Han Kang's Nobel spurs hope of Korean literature's global recognition

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kenya will send 600 more police officers to Haiti next month to bolster an international anti-gang mission, President William Ruto said on Friday during a visit by the Haitian prime minister intended to speed up deployments to the force.
articles.title: Kenya to send more police to Haiti after new gang attacks

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Uruguay heads to the polls to vote for a new president this month, but investors have a wary eye on another ballot: a referendum to lower the retirement age in the fast-aging nation that some fear may cripple the country's finances.
articles.title: Uruguay referendum could see retirement age falling to 60

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy at the Vatican on Friday morning for their second face-to-face encounter in four months.
articles.title: Pope Francis meets Ukraine's Zelenskiy at Vatican
